meanings.definition: The solid matrix of rock in which crystals are embedded.
meanings.sent1: The groundmass of the rock held the crystals firmly in place.
meanings.sent2: Geologists study the groundmass to understand the composition of the rock.
meanings.sent3: The groundmass decided to throw a crystal party, but no one showed up.
meanings.sent4: The groundmass was like a protective shield, surrounding the precious crystals.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the groundmass appeared as a dense network of minerals.

meanings.definition: The principal mass or body of a rock or mineral distinct from other parts such as crystals or veins.
meanings.sent1: The groundmass of the boulder was massive and solid.
meanings.sent2: Miners often analyze the groundmass to locate valuable minerals.
meanings.sent3: The groundmass felt proud to be the main attraction in the rock show.
meanings.sent4: The groundmass stood out like a giant among the tiny crystals around it.
meanings.sent5: The groundmass seemed to anchor the entire rock structure together.
